comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.0.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-US; rv:1.9.2.14) 

Let's say you would like to add a filter that does action X when subject is A and from is B.

So you set first rule and then you click "+" to add second rule.

Clicking "+" is really unnecessary -- TB should always add new blank "rule" if the last one is filled (the same applies for actions).

Which such UI, user would add rule A and then add rule B. No need for explicit "adding".

Reproducible: Always
comments.author: bluedzins@wp.pl
comments.creator: bluedzins@wp.pl

Let's say you would like to add a filter that does action X when subject is A and from is B.

So you set first rule and then you click "+" to add second rule.

Clicking "+" is really unnecessary -- TB should always add new blank "rule" if the last one is filled (the same applies for actions).

Which such UI, user would add rule A and then add rule B. No need for explicit "adding".

Reproducible: Always
